body:
I too am experiencing a very similar issue to the one described above. I have ~20 labelled frames from each of the 10 different videos for training. After using the crop and label, there was around 2000 cropped frames (400x400 if i recall correctly). Eventually, the process crashes with the following error:

wx._core.wxAssertionError: C++ assertion "m_hdc" failed at ..\..\src\msw\textmeasure.cpp(64) in wxTextMeasure::BeginMeasuring(): Must not be used with non-native wxDCs 

This is occurring in Windows 10, and deeplabcut==2.2b7.

As described above, with *Want to plot predictions (as in standard DLC projects)* set to no, the process completes as normal, but without the images.

can you both confirm you are using <4.1.0 wxPython?

`import wx`
`wx.__version__`

```
import wx
wx.__version__
'4.0.4'
```

and for other packages if it helps...
<details>

```
In [1]: import wx
In [2]: wx.__version__
Out[2]: '4.0.7'
```

On my latest attempt to plot everything during evaluation, windows task manager is now showing the memory leak issue whereas it didn't show it before. Note that this is NOT a cropped training data set (higher resolution images though).

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/9662673/94351045-909c9100-0022-11eb-9c31-7d15997d4834.png).

Once it gets to less than 100 MB of available RAM, 1-3 GB get cleared and then refill. It looks like the clearing is only happening by adding committed (virtual) memory, and the plotting processes are not releasing any memory. If you compare this screenshot with the previous you can see a large increase in committed memory.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/9662673/94351124-93e44c80-0023-11eb-83c6-fd2ec9e490b4.png)

My guess is the crash eventually occurs when it runs out of space for virtual memory on my SSD.
Will be fixed in #1208! Thanks for the patience on this one 👯
